text: Pepinia alexanderi is a species of plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is endemic to Ecuador, where it is known from only three subpopulations in Morona-Santiago Province. It grows in Amazonian forest habitat, and it is threatened by deforestation.Manzanares, J.M. & Pitman, N. 2003. Pepinia alexanderi. The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species 2003. Downloaded on 09 September 2015. ==References== alexanderi Category:Endangered plants Category:Endemic flora of Ecuador Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Pepinia alexanderi
